titleStmt.title: Charge to the Charset Issues Work Group

body.head: TEI Workgroup on Charset Issues : Charge
body.p: As a part of the immediate revision of the TEI Guidelines, the Board of Directors of the TEI Consortium has decided to set up a special workgroup on character set encoding issues. This document specifies the charter of that workgroup, and is formally binding on the work group members.

Specific issues to be addressed by the Workgroup include (but are not limited to) the proper use of Unicode, the structure and content of the TEI Writing System Declaration, the usability of Unicode private-use spaces, the LANG attribute and its relation to xml:lang.

The Workgroup should endeavour to ensure that adoption of its recommendations will not invalidate existing TEI documents, as far as this is possible, and to propose simple conversion paths where it is not.

The Workgroup's output should include specific recommendations for rewordings or revisions to the current text of TEI P4, which must be made available by the end of September 2001. The Workgroup may also choose to propose a more detailed plan of subsequent work to be carried out by itself or by a successor group, in the form of a discussion paper or draft set of recommendations for debate.

The proposed initial membership of the workgroup is as follows:
Christian Wittern, Kyoto University (wittern@kanji.zinbun.kyoto-u.ac.jp) : chair
Deborah Anderson, Berkeley (dwanders@socrates.berkeley.edu)
David Birnbaum, Pitssburgh University (djbpitt+@pitt.edu)
Patrick Durusau, Emory University (pdurusau@emory.edu)
Durgesh Rao, NCST Mumbai
Maria Gavrilidou
The two TEI editors sit ex officio on all TEI workgroups. Additional members may be invited to join the group at the discretion of the Chair, and subject to approval by the Board.

The Workgroup should conduct its business as far as possible according to the rules specified by TEI Document EDW 54, except where otherwise directed by the Board or (when it is constituted) the TEI Council. Because of tight time constraints, it is expected that this Workgroup will conduct its business almost exclusively by electronic means: a private mailing list and webspace will be provided for that purpose.
